task_summary: Stack two bowls by picking up the top bowl and placing it precisely on top of the bottom bowl in a stable configuration.

task_long_description.overview: This episode involves a robotic manipulator stacking two bowls. The workspace contains at least two bowls: a bottom (target) bowl and a top bowl, each visible and reachable. The robot must accurately identify the bowls, grasp the top bowl, align and place it onto the bottom bowl with a centered alignment, and then retreat. The process should minimize collisions, ensure stable placement, and release the bowl gently.
preconditions: Both bowls are visible to the camera.
The robot's gripper is empty and operational.
stepwise_plan: Detect the bottom and top bowls.
Open the gripper to the required width.
Move to a position above the top bowl.
Compute and move to the grasp pose.
Grasp the top bowl using a top grasp.
Stack the top bowl onto the bottom bowl, aligning centers.
Open the gripper to release the bowl.
success_criteria: The top bowl is placed centrally and stably on the bottom bowl.
No bowls are dropped or toppled.
The gripper releases the bowl cleanly.
failure_and_recovery: If grasp fails: re-open the gripper and retry pose computation and grasp.
If object detection fails: retry or perform perceptual scan.
If placement is misaligned: recover by adjusting and retrying Stack action.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the top bowl is stacked with stable alignment and the gripper has retreated.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Detects and localizes the bottom bowl.
Detects and localizes the top bowl.
Opens gripper to allow approach for grasping bowl.
Moves end effector to a position above the top bowl.
Computes a top-down grasp pose for the top bowl.
Grasps top bowl at computed pose.
Moves above where the stack should occur (over the bottom bowl).
Aligns and stacks the top bowl onto the bottom bowl with minimal required force.
Opens the gripper to release the top bowl.
Moves the gripper away from the stacked bowls.

failure_modes: Failure to detect one or both bowls
Failure to grasp the top bowl
recovery_strategy: Retry detection and grasp pose computation
Retry grasping or shifting approach if slip detected
Realign and retry stacking if not centered
assumptions: Instruction only specifies 'stack bowls', but frames indicate exactly two bowls, with one to be stacked atop the other.
No frames show obvious failure or retries, so a single-pass stack sequence is assumed.
No direct evidence for containers, other objects, or additional modalities beyond top-view RGB.
Force, alignment and pose parameters inferred from visual input and generic stacking requirements.

expected_success_criteria: Top bowl on bottom bowl with minimal lateral offset
No slips or tilts; both bowls upright and nested
